section.para: The ngx_http_v2_module module (1.9.5) provides support for HTTP/2 and supersedes the ngx_http_spdy_module module.
This module is not built by default, it should be enabled with the --with-http_v2_module configuration parameter.

para.note: This module is also available as part of our commercial subscription in the nginx-plus-http2 package of NGINX Plus release 7.

section.name: Example Configuration

directive.name: http2_chunk_size
directive.para:
Sets the maximum size of chunks into which the response body is sliced. A too low value results in higher overhead. A too high value impairs prioritization due to
HOL blocking.

directive.name: http2_idle_timeout
directive.para: Sets the timeout of inactivity after which the connection is closed.

directive.name: http2_max_concurrent_streams
directive.para: Sets the maximum number of concurrent HTTP/2 streams in a connection.

directive.name: http2_recv_buffer_size
directive.para: Sets the size of the per worker input buffer.

directive.name: http2_recv_timeout
directive.para: Sets the timeout for expecting more data from the client, after which the connection is closed.

section.name: Embedded Variables
section.para:
The ngx_http_v2_module module supports the following embedded variables:
$http2
negotiated protocol identifier: “h2” for HTTP/2 over TLS, “h2c” for HTTP/2 over cleartext TCP, or an empty string otherwise.
